means: 使过热，变得过热( overheat的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: I think the reaction has been a little overheated.
sentence.Network_cn: 我认为这一反应有些过激。

sentence.Network_en: They became overheated nationalists, militarists, and they were out to conquer.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们变成了过分狂热的民族主义分子和军国主义分子，并想要征服别国。

sentence.Network_en: In America, overheated drivers have been known to shoot each other.
sentence.Network_cn: 在美国，据说司机在盛怒之下会拔枪互射。

PerfectNetExp.abs: overheated zone 过热区overheated 过热的overheater 过热器
and the same is true if we let much salt out the skin when we get overheated .假使我们因受热过多从皮肤排出了大量的盐，情况同样如此。

at last finds that the real estate price is high , the real estate market is overheated . although it doesn't have a bubble , but are still great risk .综合分析结果发现我国当前房地产价格总体偏高，房地产市场有过热的趋势，虽未产生行业泡沫，但存在较大风险。
he did warn there is a risk the Chinese economy will become overheated .但同时他警告说，中国经济有呈现过热的趋向。

而此种透过热传导的被动散热方式逐渐不能符合小尺寸晶片的需求,导致线路局部过热(local overheating) 问题的产生。此外,一些光学的感测器或雷射晶片亦需要体积小且.

entry.tran: 十分愤怒的；过于激烈的
entry.def: Someone who is overheated is very angry about something.

example.ex: I think the reaction has been a little overheated...
example.tran: 我认为这一反应有些过激。

example.ex: In America, overheated drivers have been known to shoot each other.
example.tran: 在美国，据说司机在盛怒之下会拔枪互射。

means.word_mean: 1. heated beyond a safe or desirable point;
